ssv.viewer¶

The ssv.viewer subpackage contains the classes necessary to create the spectrum visualisations.

Submodules¶

ssv.viewer.SimpleSpectralLines module¶

class ssv.viewer.SimpleSpectralLines.SimpleSpectralLines(lines=None)¶

Bases: object

Class to control spectral lines in the final Chart

build_chart(wavelength_unit=Unit('nm'), **kwargs)¶

Build an altair Chart with the data from the visible spectra

Parameters

  • wavelength_unit – Set the wavelength unit for the data used in the Chart

  • **kwargs – Passed to plotting.plot_lines

Returns

Return type

altair.Chart

offset_wavelength(offset)¶

Set an amount by which to offset the wavelength values of specific spectra

Parameters

offset – The amount by which to offset the wavelengths

redshift_wavelength(z)¶

Set a redshift z to offset the wavelength values of specific spectra

Parameters

z – The redshift value used to offest wavelengths

set_wavelength_limits(wavelength_min, wavelength_max)¶

Set the range within which the spectral lines should be rendered

Parameters

  • wavelength_min – Minimum wavelength value

  • wavelength_max – Maximum wavelength value

to_dataframe(wavelength_unit=Unit('nm'))¶

Create a pandas DataFrame containing all data from the spectral lines that are within the wavelength limits

Parameters

wavelength_unit – Set the wavelength unit for the resulting DataFrame

Returns

Return type

pandas.DataFrame

ssv.viewer.SimpleSpectrum module¶

class ssv.viewer.SimpleSpectrum.SimpleSpectrum(name, data)¶

Bases: object

Controller class to more easily deal with the spectrum data Internally uses SpectrumIndividual objects to store pairs of wavelength and flux

name¶

The name of the SimpleSpectrum object, used as part of the label in the final chart

build_chart(wavelength_unit=Unit('nm'), **kwargs)¶

Build a altair Chart with the data from the visible spectra

Parameters

  • wavelength_unit – Set the wavelength unit for the data used in the Chart

  • **kwargs – Passed to plotting.plot_spectra

Returns

Return type

If no data in the Chart, returns None, else returns an altair Chart of the visible spectra

flux_range(*trace_keys)¶

Get dictionary of the maxima and minima of the flux for the specified spectra

Parameters

*trace_keys – Spectra keys for which to return the flux range

Returns

Return type

Dictionary of the input keys with the flux ranges of the associated spectra

offset_flux(offset, *trace_keys)¶

Set an amount by which to offset the flux values of specific spectra

Parameters

  • offset – The amount by which to offset the flux

  • *trace_keys – The keys of the spectra to offset

offset_wavelength(offset, *trace_keys)¶

Set an amount by which to offset the wavelength values of specific spectra

Parameters

  • offset – The amount by which to offset the wavelengths

  • *trace_keys – The keys of the spectra to offset

redshift_wavelength(z, *trace_keys)¶

Set a redshift z to offset the wavelength values of specific spectra

Parameters

  • z – The redshift value used to offest wavelengths

  • *trace_keys – The keys of the spectra to offset

set_trace_visible(trace_key, visible=True)¶

Toggle the visibility of an individual spectrum

Parameters

  • trace_key – The key for the SpectrumIndividual object to toggle visibility

  • visible – If True, the spectrum will be visible, else it will not be visible

set_transform_functions(trace_keys=None, functions=None)¶

Set the list of transform functions to be applied to spectra before the DataFrame is returned

Parameters

  • trace_keys – List of spectra keys to apply the transform functions to

  • functions – List of transform functions to apply

set_variance_visible(trace_key, visible=True)¶

Toggle the visibility of the variance for a spectrum

Parameters

  • trace_key – The key for the SpectrumIndividual object to turn on variance

  • visible – If True, variance will be visible, else it will not be visible

set_visible_traces(*trace_keys)¶

Toggle which spectra are visible in the final dataframe

Parameters

*trace_keys – Keys to set visible. Any key not listed here will be set to not visible

to_dataframe(wavelength_unit=Unit('nm'))¶

Create a pandas DataFrame containing all data from the spectra that are set to be visible in the chart

Parameters

wavelength_unit – Set the wavelength unit for the resulting DataFrame

Returns

Return type

None or pandas.DataFrame

class ssv.viewer.SimpleSpectrum.SpectrumIndividual(purpose, data)¶

Bases: object

The container class to actually hold the spectrum data

set_transform_functions(*functions)¶

Set the transform functions to be applied to every spectrum

Parameters

*functions – Transform functions

show_variance(show=True)¶

Toggles whether or not the variance should be included when converting to a dataframe

Parameters

show – If True, the variance will be included in the dataframe

to_dataframe()¶

Applies transform functions and converts the spectrum data to a pandas DataFrame

Returns

DataFrame columns for wavelength, flux and (optionally) the variance

Return type

pandas.DataFrame

property wavelength_redshift¶

ssv.viewer.SimpleSpectrumViewer module¶

class ssv.viewer.SimpleSpectrumViewer.SimpleSpectrumViewer(name, wavelength_limits=None)¶

Bases: object

SimpleSpectrumViewer class description

add_lines(lines)¶

Add a SimpleSpectralLines object to the viewer

Parameters

lines – The SimpleSpectralLines object to be added to the viewer

add_spectrum(spectrum)¶

Add a SimpleSpectrum to the viewer

Parameters

spectrum – The SimpleSpectrum object to be added to the viewer

build_chart()¶

Altair Chart constructed using the selected data from SimpleSpectrum and SimpleSpectralLines objects, along with the set chart parameters

Returns

Return type

The Altair Chart

get_all_spectrum_chart_data()¶

Return a dataframe of wavelengths and spectra for all SimpleSpectrum objects in the viewer

Returns

  • all_spectrum_chart_data – Pandas Dataframe containing the wavelength and spectra values for all SimpleSpectrum objects in the viewer

  • wavelength_min – The smallest wavelength value in the dataframe

  • wavelength_max – The largest wavelength value in the dataframe

remove_lines()¶

Removes SimpleSpectralLines object from the viewer

remove_spectrum(spectrum)¶

Remove a SimpleSpectrum object from the viewer

Parameters

spectrum – Name of the SimpleSpectrum object to be removed from the viewer

set_chart_width_height(width=None, height=None)¶

Set the width and height of the chart

Parameters

  • width – Width of the chart in pixels

  • height – Height of the chart in pixels

set_flux_unit(unit)¶

Set the flux unit

Parameters

unit – Unit to be used for flux data

set_wavelength_unit(unit)¶

Set the wavelength unit

Parameters

unit – Unit to be used for wavelength data

set_x_axis_title(title)¶

Set the x-axis title

Parameters

title – Title of the x-axis

set_x_range(x_min, x_max)¶

Sets the range of the x-axis in the final chart

Parameters

  • x_min – The minimum of the x-axis extent

  • x_max – The maximum of the x-axis extent

set_y_axis_title(title)¶

Set the y-axis title

Parameters

title – Title of the y-axis

set_y_range(y_min, y_max)¶

Sets the range of the y-axis in the final chart

Parameters

  • y_min – The minimum of the y-axis extent

  • y_max – The maximum of the y-axis extent

show_grid(show=True)¶

Turn the chart grid on or off

Parameters

show – If True, grid will be visible in the chart

show_legend(show=True)¶

Turn the chart legend on or off

Parameters

show – If True, legend will be visible in the chart
